par.text: Sulphur was known as early as ancient times. It was used for fumigation, to repel evil spirits and diseases and to combat misfortune. It was recognised as an element by Antoine Laurent Lavoisier in 1777. Sulphur is a yellow, brittle non-metal, usually found in the form of a solid crystalline mass; it is tasteless, but has a faint, characteristic odour. It is flammable.
